content.raw:
It looks like the "Zaber Core Serial Library in Python" ([link](https://www.zaber.com/wiki/Software)) provides Python 2 and 3 compatibility in the same spirit as we do - it is accepting of any string type for its send functions, and returns unicode strings from its read functions. So that is ideal.

However, that's not what's being used by the device code. In fact I can't find the 'zaberapi' anywhere on the web - was this perhaps in in-house Monash thing based on the zaber 'legacy Python scripts' ([link](https://www.zaber.com/wiki/Software/Python))?

If so, this device code should be ported to use the new Zaber library, which looks to be good quality.

I've resolved the merge conflicts but I think merging will just result in broken code until this is looked at more closely.
